Lymphadenitis - Inflammation of the lymph nodes
Periodontal disease - Inflammation and infection of the gums and supportive structures of the teeth
Anemia - A condition in which the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to the bodys tissues
Flushing - A sudden reddening of the face
or upper chest due to increased blood flow
Pallor - An abnormal paleness of the skin
often due to anemia or poor circulation
Leukemia - A type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow
Infectious mononucleosis - A viral infection that can cause lymphadenitis
Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) - An autoimmune disorder that can cause lymphadenitis
Rheumatoid arthritis - A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting joints
which can cause anemia and lymphadenitis
